title: Drawing, "First Studies for the Villa Stein-de Monzie, Garches, France", 1926
medium: Graphite on white paperboard, mounted on canvas
inscribed:
1936-60-1 through 1936-60-8-2 (formerly -60-8b) originally mounted together on canvas, since separated. Inscription remains between 1936-60-8-1 (formerly -60-8a) and 1936-60-8-2 (formerly -60-8b), but applies to all nine pieces.

Inscribed in pen in black ink, on left: Premiers croquis fait/ en 1926/ (Album à dessin)/ en septembre dans/ la propriéte/ "Le Lac"/ au bord du/ lac Léman: and on right: villa Stein/ à Garches/ achevée en 1927/  Le Corbusier (underlined).
provenance: Le Corbusier (Charles Edouard Jeanneret-Gris), prior to 1936
creditline: Museum purchase from James B. Ford and Peter Cooper Hewitt Estate Funds
description: Various working sketches scattered over page.  Floor plans at center and lower left; one elevation at center, left; two exterior aerial perspectives above, two exterior aerial perspectives below, plus additional notations.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "First Studies for the Villa Stein-de Monzie, Garches, France", 1926.
1926. Graphite on white paperboard, mounted on canvas. Museum purchase from James B. Ford and Peter Cooper Hewitt Estate Funds. 1936-60-1.
